intro: Pistolochia remota, commonly known as the remote pistolpod, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated, curved pods that open to release the seeds when mature. The species is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots and drought-resistant features.
